byline.contributor: Saeed al-Batati contributed reporting from Mukalla, Yemen, and Kareem Fahim from Djibouti.
byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Saudi Arabia continues its military campaign against Houthi rebels in Yemen, defying international pressure to curb airstrikes; reframes argument justifying military action, blaming aggression of Houthis for provoking Saudi military response; situation underscores limited influence of Obama administration in leveraging broad cease-fire.
lead_paragraph: An aerial operation by Saudi-led forces in Taiz, combined with reports of continued fighting, dampened hopes for a broad cease-fire.

headline.main: Saudi Resolve on Yemen Reflects Limits of U.S. Strategy
headline.print_headline: Saudi Resolve Reflects Limits of U.S. Strategy

snippet: An aerial operation by Saudi-led forces in Taiz, combined with reports of continued fighting, dampened hopes for a broad cease-fire.
